text.content:
ED NURSING ASSESSMENT:
Chief Complaint:  elevated temp, abd pain, malaise today.
pt ambulated to er bed 6.  20g PIV placed, R hand, labs and blood culture drawn. 


APPEARANCE: No acute distress
MOBILITY: ambulates
Assistive devices used: n/a
MENTAL SCREEN:
Alert and responsive.
Oriented to name, place, date, SS#


PAIN ASSESSMENT (WILDCATS)
Patient Words Describing pain or Pain Behaviors Observed:
   back or abdominal pain - it moves
Intensity (0 no pain 10 worst possible) 2 
   Pain behaviors mild, moderate, severe :
   mild now, moderate earlier today and yesterday
Location(s):
   Abd, flank
Duration:
   intermittent
Patient's Comfort Goal  1:

Aggravating/Alleviating Factors:
   urinating
Treatments (Drug and Non Drug, Past, Present, & Beliefs):
   none
Symptoms and Side Effects of pain and pain treatments:
   none

 
SYSTEMS REVIEW:
   SKIN
   Skin Color
      Normal for ethnic group 
   Temperature
      Warm 
   Skin Moisture
      Moist
   PULMONARY:
        Respirations Normal 

Lungs:
   Clear  LUL, LLL, RUL, RML, RLL
Cough
No cough 
   ABDOMINAL ASSESSMENT
   Abdomen    soft
   Bowel sounds: normal
   Bowel Frequency 
   GI problems    none 
   Patient is continent
 
1346- MD at bedside.

1355- UA and 2nd blood culture obtained. 

1435- Patial lab results back.  UA + Cultured added on by lab.

1445- Assist patient to BR.

1505- NS running at 100cc/hr.

1523- patient will beadmitted when bed is available.  First dose IV Abx given - 
Unasyn 1.5 gm over 30 minutes.

1640- Report called to charge nurse on 7A Gen Med.

1710- Patient transported to 7A Gen Med bed 5 via gurney.  All belongings are 
with patient.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,TWENTYNINE

nationalTitle.title: RN EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT E & M NOTE
